description:
The admin API call GET https://$ENDPOINT/v2/$ENVIRONMENT/os-hypervisors/$ID/uptime returns a 500 and gives the following message: "The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: …)". It is expected that the call give the ability to see uptime for a given hypervisor.

sample request:

Req: curl -i https://10.23.244.95:8774/v2/preprod-ord-rackeradminapi/os-hypervisors/preprod-ord\!c0001@51/uptime -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: preprod-ord-rackeradminapi" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: e70f488663dd4f1f8cd41409d22a84c6" -k

Res: {"computeFault": {"message": "The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation.", "code": 500}}
title: os-hypervisors/$ID/uptime fails in cell setup

comments.content:
Root cause for the bug:

The uptime call fails only in case of cell-setup because nova.compute.cells_api.HostAPI doesn't have 'get_host_uptime' method implementation . When called from controller this method gets picked up from parent class nova.compute.api.HostAPI and hence throws exception.

Fix:
Implement 'get_host_uptime' in nova.compute.cells_api.HostAPI .
